alert.note: Alert for Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:01AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Lewis and Clark, southeastern Teton and northwestern Cascade Counties through 345 AM MDT... At 300 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Augusta, or 15 miles southwest of Choteau, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fairfield. This includes the following highways... Highway 287 between mile markers 42 and 59. Highway 89 between mile markers 23 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
